alert.note: Alert for Albemarle; City of Fairfax; City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Culpeper; Fairfax; Fauquier; Greene; Loudoun; Madison; Orange; Prince William; Rappahannock (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 22 at 8:35PM EST by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 AM EST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...Portions of central Virginia, northern Virginia and northwest Virginia, including the following counties: in central Virginia, Albemarle, Greene and Orange. In northern Virginia, City of Fairfax, City of Manassas, City of Manassas Park, Culpeper, Fairfax, Fauquier, Loudoun and Prince William. In northwest Virginia, Madison and Rappahannock. * WHEN...Until 230 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 833 PM EST, local law enforcement reported some roadways are flooding in the warned area. Flooding is already occurring. Between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Centreville... Dale City... Reston... Leesburg... Annandale... Springfield... South Riding... Herndon... Fairfax... Culpeper... Vienna... Broadlands... Lansdowne... Lowes Island... Brambleton... Warrenton... Mantua... Pimmit Hills... Orange... Madison... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

area.areaDesc: Albemarle; City of Fairfax; City of Manassas; City of Manassas Park; Culpeper; Fairfax; Fauquier; Greene; Loudoun; Madison; Orange; Prince William; Rappahannock
